snippet: More than two months after Brooklyn voters went to the polls, a hand recount gave David Storobin, a Republican, a slim lead, and his Democratic opponent, Lewis A. Fidler, conceded.
abstract: Democrat Lewis A Fidler concedes the contested special election for State Senate race in Brooklyn, after a final hand recount gives the 27th District seat to Republican David Storobin by an unofficial 16-vote margin.
lead_paragraph: More than two months after Brooklyn voters went to the polls, a hand recount gave David Storobin, a Republican, a slim lead, and his Democratic opponent, Lewis A. Fidler, conceded.

headline.seo: David Storobin Poised to Win Brooklyn State Senate Seat After Recount
headline.main: After Recount, Republican’s Opponent Concedes a State Senate Race in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: After Recount, Republican’s Opponent Concedes a State Senate Race in Brooklyn
